counties.name: Bexar
counties.demographicsBlurb: Large urban county centered on San Antonio; 2020 population ~2.01M with majority-Hispanic population (~59%). Education profile: bachelor's degree or higher is roughly around one-third of adults (ACS/Census profile range).
counties.politicalBlurb: Election snapshot: countywide voting has leaned Democratic in recent cycles; benchmark presidential county result was roughly Democratic ~58% vs Republican ~40% (verify race-specific local contests each cycle).

counties.name: Travis
counties.demographicsBlurb: Austin-centered county with highly educated urban population and major tech-sector footprint; bachelor's degree-or-higher share is among the highest in Texas (roughly around half of adults).
counties.politicalBlurb: Election snapshot: strongly Democratic in recent cycles; benchmark presidential county result was roughly Democratic ~72% vs Republican ~27% (verify race-specific local contests each cycle).

courts.name: 53rd District Court

counties.name: Harris
counties.demographicsBlurb: Texasâ€™s largest county with very high diversity and large urban/suburban population; education profile is above state average with strong variation by precinct and municipality.
counties.politicalBlurb: Election snapshot: countywide results have leaned Democratic in recent cycles; benchmark presidential county result was roughly Democratic ~56% vs Republican ~43% (verify race-specific local contests each cycle).

counties.name: Hidalgo
counties.demographicsBlurb: Border county with large Hispanic majority population and significant bilingual court-access needs; education attainment has improved over time but remains below Texas metro-county averages.
counties.politicalBlurb: Election snapshot: historically Democratic-leaning but increasingly competitive in statewide cycles; benchmark presidential county result was roughly Democratic ~58% vs Republican ~41% (verify race-specific local contests each cycle).

courts.name: 92nd District Court

counties.name: Dallas
counties.demographicsBlurb: Large metro county with diverse urban and suburban population composition; education attainment is relatively high with substantial graduate/professional concentration in core urban areas.
counties.politicalBlurb: Election snapshot: countywide results have leaned Democratic in recent cycles; benchmark presidential county result was roughly Democratic ~65% vs Republican ~34% (verify race-specific local contests each cycle).
